body.p: Your petitioners, the undersigned, would respectfully represent & state that One, Jesse T. McCormack, was recognized to appear at the July term 1862 of the Warren Equity & criminal court, in a bond of four hundred dollars, with the Subscribers his Securities. The said Jesse T. is & was a young & inexperienced man & by the advise of evil disposed persons & contrary to the advise & wishes of your petitioners, he left this State & of Consequince, his bond was, at the Feby. term 1863, forfeited ^and judgement rendered thereon at sd last mentioned term^ & your peititioners are now liable to pay the judgement of 400$ so as aforesaid rendered against them- By the courtesy of the Comth's. atty. the execution is suspended until we can hear from your excellency- Now we beg leave to State that all of us, with One exception, are in very limited cirumstances & have as much as we can conveniently do to Support our families & to pay the afd judgment, altho'. apparently Small, will oppress us- Wherefore we respectfully ^pray^ a remission of the afd Judgt. or so much thereof as you are authorized to remit-

As execution has been suspended
until we can hear from you- Permit us to hope to receive a favorable response at your earliest convenience-

With high consideration, we are
Very respectfully
Your obt svts

Wm Halsell
James M. Halsell
John S. Jones
John. W. Grubbs
James Jones
James J. McCarmick

We the undersigned citizens of Warren County state that we know the gentlemen whose signatures appear above, & have implicit confidence in the truth of their above statements, and concur with them in their ^prayer &^ foregoing petition

very respectfully &C
W H Payne
Wm V. Loving
R Rodes
P,, Hines
